meta_description: SF Heritage is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) membership organization with a mission to preserve and enhance San Francisco’s unique architectural and cultural identity. This includes advocacy for historic resources, education programs, and tours and rental of the 1886 Haas-Lilienthal House.
accessibility_text:
# Adaptive Reuse at the Doolan-Larson House

  * November 18, 2025
  * [Doolan-Larson Building](http://www.sfheritage.org/category/doolan-larson-building/)
  * by [SF Heritage](http://www.sfheritage.org/author/cpm/)

[](https://www.sfheritage.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/Logo_Doolan-Larson_Warp_black_1000.png)

**Welcome back to the final** **“Past Meets Possibility”** **newsletter from SF Heritage**.

_On August 1, SF Heritage published a Request for Concept Proposals to transform the Doolan-Larson House and Storefronts into “a dynamic, community-centered cultural destination.”_

_Between August and November, we’ve shared monthly highlights about how this landmark, at the iconic corner of Haight and Ashbury streets, has adapted and reinvented itself over time. SF Heritage has also surveyed the Haight-Ashbury community to hear what they would like to see at the Doolan-Larson House and Storefronts:_[_**click here**_](https://haightandashbury.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/20251030_DLHA-Community-Survey.pdf) _for the results._

_The RFCP deadline is_** _this Friday, November 21, at 11:59 pm PST_** _. If you are ready to submit your Concept Proposal,_[**_you can do so through the portal linked here_**](https://haightandashbury.org/rfcp/) _. We look forward to hearing from you!_

_For our final newsletter, we’ll discuss adaptive reuse at the Doolan-Larson House and Storefronts and how a historic building provides exciting opportunities to honor the past and reimagine the future...
